title: First Morocco, then Japan and now Korea.... done knocking out the big teams

author: ArclightInsights
text: Which Big team did South Korea eliminate exactly?

author: [deleted]
text: Uruguay mate

author: ArclightInsights
text: Oh sorry. I didn't realise they were considered a big team. Thanks

author: Projeffboy
text: in terms of history they are, they've won 2 world cups and have 4 stars

author: nico_cali
text: A hundred years ago, they were a big team, for sure.

author: Projeffboy
text: they reached top 4 in 2010, so theyre still relevant

author: nico_cali
text:
You said they were relevant from what they did 100 years ago. Now they’re a “big team” for coming in 4th 12 years ago?

Last 8 World Cups they didn’t qualify 3 times, twice they didn’t get out of the group stage, other three times they got to knock outs, they got 4th once. Not a “big team”. They’re fringe mediocre and with Suárez and Cavani retiring, they go into another slump for 10-20 years. Valverde is the exception but he can’t carry the team, especially in his position.

author: Horsedrinking
text: They shouldn’t have though, cheaters

author: Projeffboy
text: ghana got a pen and suarez was suspended against netherlands. What more do u want

author: Horsedrinking
text:
Ghana to be given the goal they would have had if the cheating had not occurred. This was not the denial of the opportunity for a goal, for which a penalty would be sufficient, it was a hand stopping the ball from going in.

Ghana should have got the goal, Uruguay should have lost.

author: Projeffboy
text: in your defence, this is a very rare situation in a high-stakes big stage game. i can't think of any other time a player tried to be keeper to get a red

author: nico_cali
text: I hate Suárez but he got a red. What happens after that is out of his hands.
